1→# hive-mind Plan
     2→
     3→A system for MATS researchers to contribute session learnings to a shared knowledge base.
     4→
     5→## Core Principles
     6→
     7→- **Storage over retrieval**: Capture now; improve retrieval later
     8→- **Yankability**: Users can retract consent and remove their data
     9→- **Human review**: All content reviewed before merging
    10→- **Privacy-conscious**: Sensitive data must not leak
    11→
    12→## Session Progress
    13→
    14→- [x] [Session 0](sessions/session-0-initial-planning.md): Initial Planning
    15→- [x] [Session 1](sessions/session-1-privacy-storage.md): Privacy & Storage Architecture
    16→- [x] [Session 2](sessions/session-2-hook-behavior.md): Hook Behavior & User Prompting

    18→- [ ] **Session 4: Hook Output Testing** ← NEXT
    19→- [ ] Session 5: Ideas Discussion
    20→- [ ] Session 6: First-Time Setup & Multi-Environment
    21→- [ ] Session 7: JSONL Format Deep Dive
    22→- [ ] Session 8: Processing Pipeline (content format + index + GitHub Action)
    23→- [ ] Session 9: Retrieval Subagent
    24→- [ ] Session 10: Testing Strategy
    25→
    26→## Architecture
    27→
    28→```
    29→SETUP (one-time)
    30→  User runs login → Stytch device flow → JWT stored in ~/.claude/alignment-hive/
    31→  Stytch webhook on signup → Convex → GitHub App invites to repo
    32→
    33→PLUGIN INSTALLATION (per-project)
    34→  User installs plugin at project scope
    35→  Plugin presence = participation
    36→
    37→SESSION TRACKING (continuous)
    38→  Stop hook → Convex heartbeat (upsert session_id, timestamp, line_count)
    39→  SessionStart hook → register session, check for pending/ready sessions
    40→
    41→SUBMISSION FLOW
    42→  SessionStart checks local session files:
    43→    - Sessions < 24h old: display to user (can exclude)
    44→    - Sessions > 24h old: queue for submission
    45→  Background script (10 min delay) → final opt-out window → upload if not excluded
    46→
    47→TRANSCRIPT UPLOAD
    48→  Background script reads JWT → uploads transcript to Convex
    49→        │
    50→        ▼
    51→CONVEX BACKEND
    52→  Validates JWT (Stytch JWKS) → stores in R2 → records metadata
    53→  Triggers GitHub Action via repository_dispatch
    54→        │
    55→        ▼
    56→GITHUB ACTION
    57→  Auth: shared secret → fetches transcript → runs Claude Code
    58→  Creates PR with extracted knowledge (or rejects if PII/not useful)
    59→  Uploads processing session to R2 for admin review
    60→        │
    61→        ▼
    62→HUMAN REVIEW
    63→  Reviewer merges PR → marketplace updates → users get new content
    64→
    65→RETRIEVAL
    66→  Subagent searches index → returns context to main agent
    67→```
    68→
    69→## Technology Decisions
    70→
    71→| Component | Choice | Rationale |
    72→|-----------|--------|-----------|
    73→| Auth | Stytch | First-class CLI device flow, JWT-based, invite-only built-in |
    74→| Backend | Convex | Real-time, supports custom JWT auth for Stytch |
    75→| File Storage | Cloudflare R2 | S3-compatible, zero egress, direct access for yankability |
    76→| Processing | GitHub Actions | Free CI minutes, Claude Code support |
    77→| Distribution | Git + plugin marketplace | Auto-updates via marketplace |
    78→| GitHub Action Auth | Shared secret | Convex-recommended for external services |
    79→| Repo Invitations | GitHub App | More secure than user OAuth tokens |
    80→| Label Generation | Derived from content | Reduces friction; AI extracts labels, not user input |
    81→| Plugin Scope | Project-level | Installed per-project; plugin presence = participation |
    82→| Session Detection | Stop hook heartbeat | Reliable; fires after every Claude response |
    83→| Submission Trigger | SessionStart hook | Checks for ready sessions; client controls timing |
    84→| Submission Delay | 24h inactivity + 10min final window | Handles long sessions; gives opt-out opportunity |
    85→
    86→## Hooks
    87→
    88→| Hook | Purpose |
    89→|------|---------|
    90→| Stop | Heartbeat to Convex (upsert session_id, timestamp, line_count) |
    91→| SessionStart | Register session, display pending sessions, submit ready sessions, show reminders |

1→# Session 2: Hook Behavior & User Prompting
     2→
     3→**Date**: 2025-12-31
     4→
     5→## Goal
     6→
     7→Understand hook behavior, determine reliable session tracking, and design user consent flow.
     8→
     9→## What We Tested
    10→
    11→### Hook Trigger Behavior
    12→
    13→Created test hooks (`test-hooks/log-all-events.sh`) to log all hook events.
    14→
    15→| Trigger | SessionEnd? | Notes |
    16→|---------|-------------|-------|
    17→| `/exit` | Yes | Clean exit |
    18→| `Ctrl+D` | Yes | Requires double-tap to confirm |
    19→| `kill -15` | Yes | SIGTERM, `reason: "other"` |
    20→| `kill -9` | No | SIGKILL, no hook fires |
    21→| Terminal close | No | No hook fires |
    22→| `/compact` | No | PreCompact fires, then SessionStart (source: compact) |
    23→
    24→### Hook Data Fields
    25→
    26→**SessionStart:**
    27→```json
    28→{
    29→  "session_id": "uuid",
    30→  "transcript_path": "/path/to/session.jsonl",
    31→  "cwd": "/working/dir",
    32→  "hook_event_name": "SessionStart",
    33→  "source": "startup" | "resume" | "compact"
    34→}
    35→```
    36→
    37→**SessionEnd:**
    38→```json
    39→{
    40→  "session_id": "uuid",
    41→  "transcript_path": "/path/to/session.jsonl",
    42→  "hook_event_name": "SessionEnd",
    43→  "reason": "exit" | "prompt_input_exit" | "other"
    44→}
    45→```
    46→
    47→**PreCompact:**
    48→```json
    49→{
    50→  "session_id": "uuid",
    51→  "transcript_path": "/path/to/session.jsonl",
    52→  "hook_event_name": "PreCompact",
    53→  "trigger": "manual" | "auto",
    54→  "custom_instructions": ""
    55→}
    56→```
    57→
    58→**Stop:**
    59→```json
    60→{
    61→  "session_id": "uuid",
    62→  "transcript_path": "/path/to/session.jsonl",
    63→  "hook_event_name": "Stop",
    64→  "stop_hook_active": false,
    65→  "permission_mode": "..."
    66→}
    67→```
    68→
    69→### Transcript Structure
    70→
    71→Verified by examining actual session files:
    72→
    73→- Format: JSONL (one JSON object per line)
    74→- **Append-only**: Compaction adds `summary` entries but does NOT truncate history
    75→- Entry types: `user`, `assistant`, `summary`, `file-history-snapshot`, `system`
    76→- Threading: Each entry has `uuid` and `parentUuid`
    77→- **Session ID persists through compaction** - same session_id before and after
    78→
    79→Entry type counts from test sessions:
    80→- Small session (no compaction): only `file-history-snapshot` entries
    81→- Large session (1 compaction): 116 assistant, 80 user, 1 summary
    82→- Our session (manual /compact): 128 assistant, 70 user, 36 summaries
    83→
    84→## Key Findings
    85→
    86→1. **SessionEnd is unreliable** for crash detection (kill -9, terminal close don't trigger)
    87→2. **Session ID is stable** - doesn't change on compaction or resume
    88→3. **Transcripts preserve full history** - safe to capture at any time
    89→4. **`source` field distinguishes** fresh sessions from resumes/post-compact
    90→5. **Hooks cannot prompt users** - no native yes/no capability
    91→
    92→## Design Evolution
    93→
    94→### Initial Design (from documentation research)
    95→
    96→Started with SessionEnd + Stop hooks + inactivity timeout controlled by Convex.
    97→
    98→### Refinements Through Discussion
    99→
   100→**Hook simplification:**
   101→- Realized SessionEnd is redundant if using inactivity timeout
   102→- Simplified to Stop hook only for heartbeat
   103→- Added SessionStart for session registration and submission trigger
   104→
   105→**Submission timing:**
   106→- Can't autonomously submit after 24h (no daemon running)
   107→- Solution: SessionStart hook checks for ready sessions
   108→- Added 10-min background script delay for final opt-out window
   109→
   110→**Project opt-out elimination:**
   111→- Key insight: plugin installed at project scope, not user scope
   112→- Collaborators automatically get access
   113→- No need for per-project opt-out tracking - plugin presence = participation
   114→
   115→**State management:**
   116→- Local state is source of truth (session status, auth)
   117→- Convex replicates for stats/debugging
   118→- Session readiness based on file modified time (no Convex query)
   119→
   120→**User prompting:**
   121→- Hooks cannot directly prompt users
   122→- SessionStart stdout goes to Claude's context (some pollution acceptable)
   123→- Need to test JSON output options in Session 3
   124→
   125→### Plugin State Storage
   126→
   127→Researched official patterns:
   128→- `.claude/settings.local.json` - official for local settings
   129→- `.claude/CLAUDE.local.md` - official for local memory
   130→- No official `plugin-name.local.md` pattern found
   131→
   132→Decision: Use `~/.claude/alignment-hive/` for user-scoped state (auth, sessions).
   133→
   134→## Decisions Made
   135→
   136→### Hooks
   137→| Hook | Purpose |
   138→|------|---------|
   139→| Stop | Heartbeat to Convex (session_id, timestamp, line_count) |
   140→| SessionStart | Register session, display pending, submit ready, show reminders |
   141→
   142→### Submission Flow
   143→1. Stop hook → Convex heartbeat (upsert)
   144→2. SessionStart → check local files for ready sessions (> 24h old)
   145→3. Display pending sessions (< 24h) for exclusion
   146→4. Launch background script with 10-min delay for final opt-out
   147→5. Background script uploads if not excluded
   148→
   149→### State Split
   150→- **Local** (`~/.claude/alignment-hive/`): auth.json, sessions/*.json
   151→- **Convex**: replicated session data for stats
   152→
   153→### Convex API
   154→```
   155→POST session/heartbeat  - Upsert session
   156→POST session/upload     - Upload transcript, trigger processing
   157→POST session/exclude    - Record exclusion for stats
   158→```
   159→
   160→## Open Questions Identified
   161→
   162→1. **Hook output to user vs Claude** - need testing (Session 3)
   163→2. **Slash command behavior** - confirmed always prompts model
   164→3. **CLI tool vs slash commands** - defer to setup session
   165→4. **Session descriptions** - defer to JSONL session
   166→5. **Summary generation** - likely compaction-only, but needs verification
   167→
   168→## Test Artifacts
   169→
   170→Test hooks were created in `test-hooks/` during this session and deleted after testing completed.
   171→Hook configuration remains in `.claude/settings.local.json`.
   172→
   173→## What Changed in Main Plan
   174→
   175→- Updated session list (added Hook Output Testing, Ideas Discussion, Plugin Naming, JSONL Deep Dive)
   176→- Added Hooks section with data fields and behavior
   177→- Added State Management section (local vs Convex)
   178→- Added Convex API section
   179→- Updated architecture diagram with refined flow
   180→- Updated technology decisions table
   181→- Plugin installed at project scope (presence = participation)
   182→

Got it! Here's the plan for **Session 4: Hook Output Testing**:

---

## Session 4: Hook Output Testing

**Goal**: Determine the best way to display information to users from hooks without polluting Claude's context.

### Background

From Session 2, we learned that hook stdout goes to Claude's context. We need to test different output methods to find the optimal approach for:
- Displaying pending sessions to users
- Showing reminders/notifications
- Avoiding unnecessary context pollution

### Tests to Run

1. **Plain stdout** - Baseline: what we know works but pollutes context

2. **JSON with `systemMessage`** - Does this show to user but not Claude?
   ```json
   {"systemMessage": "Your pending sessions: ..."}
   ```

3. **JSON with `suppressOutput`** - Can we selectively suppress?
   ```json
   {"suppressOutput": true, "otherData": "..."}
   ```

4. **Slash command with `disable-model-invocation`** - Can a command display info without triggering Claude?
   - Frontmatter option: `disable-model-invocation: true`

### Deliverables

- Test results documenting each approach's behavior
- Recommendation for hive-mind hook output strategy
- Update main plan with findings

### Method

Create simple test hooks/commands, run them, observe behavior, document results.

---

Does this plan look right? Any aspects you want to add or change before we start?

Done! Here are your testing instructions:

---

## Test Instructions

### Test 1: Plain stdout (baseline)

```bash
cp test-hooks/config-test1-plain.json .claude/settings.local.json
```

Then start a **new Claude session** in this directory:
```bash
claude
```

**Observe**: Does the hook output appear? Say "hi" and ask Claude if it can see any hook output in its context.

---

### Test 2: JSON with systemMessage

```bash
cp test-hooks/config-test2-systemmsg.json .claude/settings.local.json
```

Start a **new Claude session**, observe, and ask Claude about hook output.

---

### Test 3: JSON with suppressOutput

```bash
cp test-hooks/config-test3-suppress.json .claude/settings.local.json
```

Start a **new Claude session**, observe if anything appears.

---

### Test 4: Slash command with disable-model-invocation

Restore original settings first:
```bash
echo '{"permissions":{"allow":["mcp__llms-fetch__fetch","WebSearch"]}}' > .claude/settings.local.json
```

Start a **new Claude session**, then run:
```
/test-no-model
```

**Observe**: Does the command content display? Does Claude respond to it?

---

### After Each Test

Note in the session file (`docs/sessions/session-4-hook-output.md`):
1. What appeared to the user (terminal output)
2. What Claude could see (ask it directly)
3. Any unexpected behavior

Come back here when done and we'll document the results!

# Session 4: Hook Output Testing

**Date**: 2026-01-02

## Goal

Determine the best way to display information to users from hooks without polluting Claude's context.

## Tests Conducted

Created test hooks for SessionStart with different output methods.

### Test 1: Plain stdout

```bash
echo "Plain text message"
```

**Result**: Output goes to model context only, NOT displayed to user.

### Test 2: JSON with systemMessage

```bash
echo '{"systemMessage": "Message with\nnewlines"}'
```

**Result**:
- User sees: `SessionStart:startup says: Message with` (newlines rendered)
- Claude sees: `SessionStart:startup hook success: Success`

Newlines (`\n`) render correctly. First line gets `SessionStart:startup says:` prepended.

### Test 3: JSON with suppressOutput

```bash
echo '{"suppressOutput": true}'
```

**Result**: Nothing shown to user, Claude sees only "hook success".

### Test 4: Slash command with disable-model-invocation

```yaml
---
disable-model-invocation: true
---
```

**Result**: Command content displayed, model still responds. This frontmatter prevents the model from invoking the command autonomously - it doesn't prevent model response when user invokes the command.

## Findings

| Method | User Sees | Claude Sees |
|--------|-----------|-------------|
| Plain stdout | Nothing | Full output |
| `systemMessage` JSON | Message (formatted) | "hook success" |
| `suppressOutput` JSON | Nothing | "hook success" |

## Decision

Use `{"systemMessage": "..."}` for user-facing hook notifications. Design messages knowing the first line gets `SessionStart:startup says:` prepended.

## Test Artifacts

Test hooks and configs created in `test-hooks/` directory. Can be deleted after session.

    26→## Architecture
    27→
    28→```
    29→SETUP (one-time)

    31→  Stytch webhook on signup → Convex → GitHub App invites to repo
    32→
    33→PLUGIN INSTALLATION (per-project)
    34→  User installs plugin at project scope
    35→  Plugin presence = participation
    36→
    37→SESSION TRACKING (continuous)
    38→  Stop hook → Convex heartbeat (upsert session_id, timestamp, line_count)
    39→  SessionStart hook → register session, check for pending/ready sessions
    40→
    41→SUBMISSION FLOW
    42→  SessionStart checks local session files:
    43→    - Sessions < 24h old: display to user (can exclude)
    44→    - Sessions > 24h old: queue for submission
    45→  Background script (10 min delay) → final opt-out window → upload if not excluded
    46→
    47→TRANSCRIPT UPLOAD
    48→  Background script reads JWT → uploads transcript to Convex
    49→        │
    50→        ▼

    52→  Validates JWT (Stytch JWKS) → stores in R2 → records metadata
    53→  Triggers GitHub Action via repository_dispatch
    54→        │
    55→        ▼
    56→GITHUB ACTION
    57→  Auth: shared secret → fetches transcript → runs Claude Code

    60→        │
    61→        ▼
    62→HUMAN REVIEW
    63→  Reviewer merges PR → marketplace updates → users get new content
    64→
    65→RETRIEVAL

    67→```

    69→## Technology Decisions
    70→
    71→| Component | Choice | Rationale |
    72→|-----------|--------|-----------|
    73→| Auth | Stytch | First-class CLI device flow, JWT-based, invite-only built-in |
    74→| Backend | Convex | Real-time, supports custom JWT auth for Stytch |
    75→| File Storage | Cloudflare R2 | S3-compatible, zero egress, direct access for yankability |
    76→| Processing | GitHub Actions | Free CI minutes, Claude Code support |
    77→| Distribution | Git + plugin marketplace | Auto-updates via marketplace |
    78→| GitHub Action Auth | Shared secret | Convex-recommended for external services |
    79→| Repo Invitations | GitHub App | More secure than user OAuth tokens |
    80→| Label Generation | Derived from content | Reduces friction; AI extracts labels, not user input |
    81→| Plugin Scope | Project-level | Installed per-project; plugin presence = participation |
    82→| Session Detection | Stop hook heartbeat | Reliable; fires after every Claude response |
    83→| Submission Trigger | SessionStart hook | Checks for ready sessions; client controls timing |

# alignment-hive

Claude Code infrastructure for AI safety researchers.

## About This Repo

This is early-stage infrastructure. @README.md serves as the living plan document - it captures current priorities, next steps, and design decisions as they evolve.

## Design Session Workflow

1. **During session**: Explore, test, discuss - create temporary artifacts as needed
2. **At session end**: Claude writes up the session file documenting what was tested and decided

1→# hive-mind Plan
     2→
     3→A system for MATS researchers to contribute session learnings to a shared knowledge base.
     4→
     5→## Core Principles
     6→
     7→- **Storage over retrieval**: Capture now; improve retrieval later
     8→- **Yankability**: Users can retract consent and remove their data
     9→- **Human review**: All content reviewed before merging
    10→- **Privacy-conscious**: Sensitive data must not leak
    11→
    12→## Session Progress
    13→
    14→- [x] [Session 0](sessions/session-0-initial-planning.md): Initial Planning
    15→- [x] [Session 1](sessions/session-1-privacy-storage.md): Privacy & Storage Architecture
    16→- [x] [Session 2](sessions/session-2-hook-behavior.md): Hook Behavior & User Prompting
    17→- [x] Session 3: Plugin Naming (hive-mind)
    18→- [x] [Session 4](sessions/session-4-hook-output.md): Hook Output Testing
    19→- [ ] **Session 5: Ideas Discussion** ← NEXT
    20→- [ ] Session 6: First-Time Setup & Multi-Environment
    21→- [ ] Session 7: JSONL Format Deep Dive
    22→- [ ] Session 8: Processing Pipeline (content format + index + GitHub Action)
    23→- [ ] Session 9: Retrieval Subagent
    24→- [ ] Session 10: Testing Strategy
    25→
    26→## Architecture
    27→
    28→```
    29→SETUP (one-time)
    30→  User runs login → Stytch device flow → JWT stored in ~/.claude/alignment-hive/
    31→  Stytch webhook on signup → Convex → GitHub App invites to repo
    32→
    33→PLUGIN INSTALLATION (per-project)
    34→  User installs plugin at project scope
    35→  Plugin presence = participation
    36→
    37→SESSION TRACKING (continuous)
    38→  Stop hook → Convex heartbeat (upsert session_id, timestamp, line_count)
    39→  SessionStart hook → register session, check for pending/ready sessions
    40→
    41→SUBMISSION FLOW
    42→  SessionStart checks local session files:
    43→    - Sessions < 24h old: display to user (can exclude)
    44→    - Sessions > 24h old: queue for submission
    45→  Background script (10 min delay) → final opt-out window → upload if not excluded
    46→
    47→TRANSCRIPT UPLOAD
    48→  Background script reads JWT → uploads transcript to Convex
    49→        │
    50→        ▼
    51→CONVEX BACKEND
    52→  Validates JWT (Stytch JWKS) → stores in R2 → records metadata
    53→  Triggers GitHub Action via repository_dispatch
    54→        │
    55→        ▼
    56→GITHUB ACTION
    57→  Auth: shared secret → fetches transcript → runs Claude Code
    58→  Creates PR with extracted knowledge (or rejects if PII/not useful)
    59→  Uploads processing session to R2 for admin review
    60→        │
    61→        ▼
    62→HUMAN REVIEW
    63→  Reviewer merges PR → marketplace updates → users get new content
    64→
    65→RETRIEVAL
    66→  Subagent searches index → returns context to main agent
    67→```
    68→
    69→## Technology Decisions
    70→
    71→| Component | Choice | Rationale |
    72→|-----------|--------|-----------|
    73→| Auth | Stytch | First-class CLI device flow, JWT-based, invite-only built-in |
    74→| Backend | Convex | Real-time, supports custom JWT auth for Stytch |
    75→| File Storage | Cloudflare R2 | S3-compatible, zero egress, direct access for yankability |
    76→| Processing | GitHub Actions | Free CI minutes, Claude Code support |
    77→| Distribution | Git + plugin marketplace | Auto-updates via marketplace |
    78→| GitHub Action Auth | Shared secret | Convex-recommended for external services |
    79→| Repo Invitations | GitHub App | More secure than user OAuth tokens |
    80→| Label Generation | Derived from content | Reduces friction; AI extracts labels, not user input |
    81→| Plugin Scope | Project-level | Installed per-project; plugin presence = participation |
    82→| Session Detection | Stop hook heartbeat | Reliable; fires after every Claude response |
    83→| Submission Trigger | SessionStart hook | Checks for ready sessions; client controls timing |
    84→| Submission Delay | 24h inactivity + 10min final window | Handles long sessions; gives opt-out opportunity |
    85→| Hook User Output | `{"systemMessage": "..."}` JSON | Shows to user, not Claude; supports newlines |
    86→
    87→## Hooks
    88→
    89→| Hook | Purpose |
    90→|------|---------|
    91→| Stop | Heartbeat to Convex (upsert session_id, timestamp, line_count) |
    92→| SessionStart | Register session, display pending sessions, submit ready sessions, show reminders |
    93→
    94→### Hook Data Available
    95→
    96→**SessionStart:**
    97→- `session_id`, `transcript_path`, `cwd`
    98→- `source`: `startup` | `resume` | `compact`
    99→
   100→**Stop:**
   101→- `session_id`, `transcript_path`, `cwd`
   102→- `stop_hook_active`, `permission_mode`
   103→
   104→### Hook Output Format
   105→
   106→To display messages to user without polluting Claude's context:
   107→```bash
   108→echo '{"systemMessage": "Line 1\nLine 2\nLine 3"}'
   109→```
   110→
   111→Note: First line gets `SessionStart:startup says:` prepended by Claude Code.
   112→
   113→### SessionStart Behavior
   114→
   115→1. Check local session files for readiness (based on file modified time)
   116→2. Display sessions < 24h (pending, can exclude)
   117→3. For sessions > 24h: launch background script with 10-min delay
   118→4. Background script checks for exclusion, uploads if not excluded
   119→
   120→## State Management
   121→
   122→### Local State (source of truth)
   123→
   124→Location: `~/.claude/alignment-hive/`
   125→
   126→| Data | Purpose |
   127→|------|---------|
   128→| `auth.json` | JWT token from Stytch |
   129→| `sessions/<session-id>.json` | Status: pending, submitted, excluded |
   130→
   131→Session readiness determined from local transcript file modified time (no Convex query needed).
   132→
   133→### Convex State (replicated for stats/debugging)
   134→
   135→```
   136→sessions:
   137→  _id: auto-generated
   138→  session_id: string        # from Claude Code
   139→  user_id: string
   140→  project: string
   141→  line_count: number
   142→  last_activity: timestamp
   143→  status: pending | submitted | excluded
   144→  transcript_r2_key: string | null
   145→```
   146→
   147→Note: Schema details subject to change during implementation.
   148→
   149→## Convex API
   150→
   151→```
   152→POST session/heartbeat
   153→  - Upsert session (create if new, update timestamp + line_count)
   154→  - Called by Stop hook
   155→
   156→POST session/upload
   157→  - Upload transcript to R2
   158→  - Trigger processing pipeline
   159→  - Called by background submission script
   160→
   161→POST session/exclude
   162→  - Record exclusion (for stats)
   163→  - Called when user excludes a session
   164→```
   165→
   166→## Open Questions
   167→
   168→### Session 5: Ideas Discussion
   169→- Ideas from time away from computer
   170→- Any architectural changes needed
   171→
   172→### Session 6: First-Time Setup
   173→- Login flow implementation
   174→- CLI tool vs slash commands for user actions
   175→- Multi-environment handling (local + cloud VM)
   176→- First-run experience and reminders
   177→
   178→### Session 7: JSONL Format
   179→- Full reverse-engineering of transcript format
   180→- Summary entry structure and purpose
   181→- Session description source (for display to user)
   182→
   183→### Session 8: Processing Pipeline
   184→- Content format and metadata extraction
   185→- Index design (monolithic vs per-session, format)
   186→- GitHub Action implementation
   187→- PR format, rejection criteria
   188→
   189→### Session 9: Retrieval
   190→- Subagent trigger conditions
   191→- Tools: grep, jq, custom?
   192→- Context amount to return
   193→
   194→### Session 10: Testing
   195→- Local testing approach
   196→- Staging branch/repo
   197→- Dry-run mode
   198→
   199→### Cross-Cutting
   200→- Consent model if expanding beyond MATS
   201→- Rollback procedure for leaked sensitive data
   202→- Plugin auto-update verification
   203→
   204→## Implementation Notes
   205→
   206→### Shared Secret Setup
   207→```bash
   208→openssl rand -hex 32
   209→```
   210→- Convex: Dashboard → Settings → Environment Variables → `GITHUB_ACTION_SECRET`
   211→- GitHub: Repo → Settings → Secrets → Actions → `CONVEX_ACTION_SECRET`
   212→
   213→## Reference Documentation
   214→
   215→- [Stytch Connected Apps CLI](https://stytch.com/docs/guides/connected-apps/cli-app)
   216→- [Stytch JWT Sessions](https://stytch.com/docs/guides/sessions/using-jwts)
   217→- [Convex Custom JWT Auth](https://docs.convex.dev/auth/advanced/custom-jwt)
   218→- [Convex R2 Component](https://www.convex.dev/components/cloudflare-r2)
   219→- [Convex HTTP Actions](https://docs.convex.dev/functions/http-actions)
   220→
   221→## Future Features (v2+)
   222→
   223→- Web dashboard for session management (view pending/submitted, batch actions, trust rules)
   224→- Yanking (user requests data deletion after submission)
   225→- User pre-review of extracted knowledge
   226→- Granular admin access permissions
   227→- Partial consent/redaction
   228→- Admin dashboard for debugging
   229→- Windows support (if not easy to include in v1)
   230→- Claude Code for web support
   231→
